body:

issue.title: Temp exclude cmdLineTester_lockWordAlignment_Object_X tests for jdk24

repository.name: openj9
repository.description: Eclipse OpenJ9: A Java Virtual Machine for OpenJDK that's optimized for small footprint, fast start-up, and high throughput.   Builds on Eclipse OMR (https://github.com/eclipse/omr) and combines with the Extensions for OpenJDK for OpenJ9 repo.

timeline_data.body:
All of these fail.
cmdLineTester_lockWordAlignment_Object_i_0
cmdLineTester_lockWordAlignment_Object_ii_0
cmdLineTester_lockWordAlignment_Object_iii_0
cmdLineTester_lockWordAlignment_Object_d_0

Exclude them via https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/pull/20981
`-bootclasspath` hasn't worked from jdk11 on. You can only use `-bootclasspath/a:`.

> -bootclasspath hasn't worked from jdk11 on. You can only use -bootclasspath/a:.

In this case, the `-bootclasspath` specific test case should be disabled from JDK11+.

@llxia We would like to disable the below test case for JDK11+. Could you help with this? 

https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/blob/2c08dad837c98ab6bf7a13ad8381a789c69b1d54/test/functional/cmdLineTests/lockWordAlignment/alignment.xml#L64-L70

Here is an example:

https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/blob/2c08dad837c98ab6bf7a13ad8381a789c69b1d54/test/functional/cmdLineTests/shareClassTests/URLHelperTests/playlist.xml#L36

https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/blob/2c08dad837c98ab6bf7a13ad8381a789c69b1d54/test/functional/cmdLineTests/shareClassTests/URLHelperTests/exclude.xml#L30

We may want to try `[1-9][0-9]+` for 11+. Please let me know if you have any questions.

When I look at the test on jdk21, it's running with --patch-module.
```
20:03:30  Running the tests with the following settings:
20:03:30  OBJECTTESTSBOOTCLASSPATH = --patch-module java.base=/home/jenkins/workspace/Test_openjdk21_j9_extended.functional_aarch64_linux_Nightly_testList_1/aqa-tests/TKG/../../jvmtest/functional/cmdLineTests/lockWordAlignment/object_iii.jar
```

I missed that we were talking about `javap` and not `java`. My comments referred to `java`. I see that `javap` help output includes `-bootclasspath <path>`. It's interesting you found it doesn't work. Perhaps it's a bug.

The test attempts to override a core JCL class, `java/lang/Object`, which is no longer allowed. I tested this with JDK 17, but the expected behavior in the test case was still observed. This restriction may have only been enforced starting in JDK 24; I didn't find any documentation on this change.

It's important to note that `Object` is not the same as `java/lang/Object`. To reproduce the issue, try using the attached JAR file as follows:
```
<PATH_TO>/javap -p -bootclasspath <PATH_TO>/object_i.jar java/lang/Object
```

You should observe the new restricted behavior. Note: `object_i.txt` is actually a JAR file and must be renamed to `object_i.jar` before use since Github doesn't allow JAR files to be attached. 

**Attachment:** [object_i.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18805385/object_i.txt)

issue.title: Disable javap -bootclasspath test in LockWordAlignment for JDK24+

repository.name: openj9
repository.description: Eclipse OpenJ9: A Java Virtual Machine for OpenJDK that's optimized for small footprint, fast start-up, and high throughput.   Builds on Eclipse OMR (https://github.com/eclipse/omr) and combines with the Extensions for OpenJDK for OpenJ9 repo.

issue.body:
Currently, the entire LockWordAlignment test suite is disabled to
suppress failure #20539.

It was observed that javap no longer overrides core JCL classes, such
as java/lang/Object, in JDK24+. This behavior is also present in the
RI.

As a result, the LockWordAlignment test suite is being re-enabled,
with only the affected sub-test impacted by the change in
javap -bootclasspath behavior being disabled.

We plan to reach out to OpenJDK developers to confirm whether this is
an intentional behavior change or a bug. Until then, #20539 will
remain open.

Related: #20539

timeline_data.body:
For JDK24+, I have opened #21136 to only disable the sub-test impacted by the change in `javap -bootclasspath` behavior.

> Perhaps it's a bug.

We can reach out to OpenJDK developers to confirm whether this is an intentional behavior change or a bug. Until then, we can keep this issue open. @pshipton Do you know which OpenJDK mailing list would be appropriate for addressing `javap` related issues?

> I'd start with https://mail.openjdk.org/mailman/listinfo/jdk-dev

I have written to the JDK mailing list mentioned above and am still awaiting their response. For this issue, both the RI and OpenJ9 exhibit the same behavior in JDK24. Therefore, this issue can be deferred to the next release until it is confirmed whether the new behavior is intentional or a bug
The following OpenJDK issue has been opened to track `javap's -bootclasspath` issue: https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8354563
